panels.content:
# About This Dashboard

This dashboard is the base dashboard for Windows which covers performance for below objects:

- CPU
- Memory
- Network
- Local Disk
- Cluster Volume

Users should **pick panels based on their own requirements**.

# Prometheus Exporter

Metrics are colleced by leveraging [telegraf](https://www.influxdata.com/time-series-platform/telegraf/) from Influxdata. A skeleton configuration file can be generated as below:

```bash
 .\telegraf.exe --section-filter agent:inputs:outputs --input-filter win_perf_counters --output-filter prometheus_client config > telegraf.conf
```

**Notes**: The configuration skeleton generated can not be used directly since it is not encoded as UTF-8. Use Notepad++ or other software to conver the encoding.

# Reference

- [Running Telegraf as a Windows Service](https://github.com/influxdata/telegraf/blob/master/docs/WINDOWS_SERVICE.md)
- [Monitoring Windows Services with Grafana, InfluxDB and Telegraf](https://www.influxdata.com/blog/monitoring-windows-services-with-grafana-influxdb-and-telegraf)
panels.title: About

targets.query: SELECT mean("Processor_Queue_Length") FROM "win_system" WHERE "host" =~ /^$hostname$/ AND "objectname" = 'System' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("Threads") FROM "win_system" WHERE "host" =~ /^$hostname$/ AND "objectname" = 'System' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

SELECT mean("Available_Bytes") as "Available Bytes", mean("Pool_Nonpaged_Bytes") as "Pool Nonpaged Bytes", mean("Pool_Paged_Bytes") as "Pool Paged Bytes" FROM "win_mem" WHERE host =~ /$hostname$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host fill(linear) ORDER BY asc

SELECT mean("Cache_Faults_persec") as "Cache Faults persec", mean("Demand_Zero_Faults_persec") as "Demand Zero Faults persec", mean("Page_Faults_persec") as "Page Faults persec", mean("Pages_persec") as "Pages persec", mean("Transition_Faults_persec") as "Transition Faults persec" FROM "win_mem" WHERE host =~ /$hostname$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host fill(0) ORDER BY asc
SELECT mean("Context_Switches_persec") AS "Context Switches persec" FROM "win_system" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", instance fill(linear)
SELECT mean("System_Calls_persec") AS "System Calls / sec" FROM "win_system" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", instance fill(linear)

SELECT mean("Bytes_Received_persec") AS "Bytes Received persec", mean("Bytes_Sent_persec") AS "Bytes Sent persec" FROM "win_net" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND "instance" =~ /$network$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", instance fill(linear)

SELECT mean("Bytes_Received_persec") AS "Bytes Received persec", mean("Bytes_Sent_persec") AS "Bytes Sent persec" FROM "win_net" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND "instance" =~ /$network$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", instance fill(linear)

SELECT mean("Bytes_Received_persec") AS "Bytes Received persec", mean("Bytes_Sent_persec") AS "Bytes Sent persec" FROM "win_net" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND "instance" =~ /$network$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", instance fill(linear)

SELECT mean("Bytes_Received_persec") AS "Bytes Received persec", mean("Bytes_Sent_persec") AS "Bytes Sent persec" FROM "win_net" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND "instance" =~ /$network$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host", instance fill(linear)
